name: Three-Phase Power Installation
description: Large commercial equipment, industrial machinery, and high-power systems often require three-phase power that standard single-phase service can't provide. Solomon Electric installs three-phase electrical service throughout South Florida—coordinating with utilities, installing appropriate panels and wiring, and connecting equipment that demands three-phase power.
warningSignsSubheading: Three-phase power serves larger loads efficiently. Here's when it becomes necessary.

problems.title: Equipment Requires 3-Phase
problems.description: Large motors, CNC machines, welders, and commercial HVAC often require three-phase power. The equipment simply won't run on single-phase.

problems.title: High Power Demands
problems.description: When total electrical load exceeds what single-phase can efficiently deliver, three-phase service provides more power capacity.

problems.title: Industrial Process Needs
problems.description: Manufacturing, machining, and industrial processes often require three-phase for specific equipment and overall capacity.

problems.title: Property Expansion
problems.description: Growing operations may exceed single-phase limitations. Upgrading to three-phase provides capacity for current and future growth.

problems.title: Commercial Kitchen Equipment
problems.description: Large commercial kitchen equipment—high-volume ovens, mixers, refrigeration—may require three-phase power.

problems.title: Data Center Needs
problems.description: Larger data installations and server rooms often require three-phase power for high-density computing loads.

process.title: Load Analysis
process.description: We calculate your total three-phase power requirements based on equipment specifications and planned operations.

process.title: Utility Coordination
process.description: We work with FPL to determine three-phase availability, transformer requirements, and utility work needed for your location.

process.title: Design and Permitting
process.description: We design the complete three-phase system—service entrance, panels, feeders—and handle all permit applications.

process.title: Infrastructure Installation
process.description: We install service entrance equipment, panels, feeders, and circuits to deliver three-phase power throughout your facility.

process.title: Equipment Connection
process.description: We connect equipment to appropriate three-phase circuits, verify proper rotation, and test complete system operation.

benefits.title: Run Required Equipment
benefits.description: Three-phase motors and equipment simply won't work on single-phase. Three-phase service enables equipment operation.

benefits.title: More Power Per Wire
benefits.description: Three-phase delivers more power with smaller conductors than single-phase. For high-power needs, it's more efficient and cost-effective.

benefits.title: Smoother Motor Operation
benefits.description: Three-phase power provides constant power delivery, making motors run more smoothly and efficiently than single-phase equivalents.

benefits.title: Industrial Capability
benefits.description: Three-phase power enables industrial equipment operation that isn't possible with single-phase service.

faqs.question: What's the difference between single-phase and three-phase power?
faqs.answer: Single-phase uses two wires (one hot, one neutral) with 120V power oscillating in one wave pattern. Three-phase uses three wires, each carrying power that peaks at different times, delivering smoother, more powerful electricity. Three-phase is more efficient for high-power applications.

faqs.question: Is three-phase power available at my location?
faqs.answer: It depends on your location and utility infrastructure. Commercial areas often have three-phase available. Residential areas typically don't. We coordinate with FPL to determine availability and what's needed to bring three-phase to your location.

faqs.question: How much does three-phase installation cost?
faqs.answer: Costs vary widely based on utility work required, distance from three-phase source, and installation complexity. If three-phase is nearby, costs are moderate. If utility must extend three-phase infrastructure, costs increase significantly. We provide detailed quotes after site assessment.

faqs.question: Can I run three-phase equipment on single-phase power?
faqs.answer: Not directly, but phase converters can create three-phase from single-phase power. Rotary phase converters work well for motors. Variable frequency drives (VFDs) can run single motors from single-phase. These are alternatives when true three-phase service isn't feasible.

faqs.question: What equipment typically requires three-phase?
faqs.answer: Large motors (5+ HP), CNC machines, large air compressors, commercial HVAC, industrial welders, large commercial kitchen equipment, and data center power systems commonly require three-phase power.

faqs.question: How long does three-phase installation take?
faqs.answer: Timeline depends heavily on utility work required. If three-phase is available nearby, installation might take 2-4 weeks. If utility must extend three-phase infrastructure (new transformers, lines), it could take 2-6 months. We clarify expected timeline during assessment.

faqs.question: What voltage is three-phase power?
faqs.answer: Common commercial three-phase voltages are 208V (wye configuration, common in smaller commercial) and 480V (larger industrial). The right voltage depends on your equipment requirements. We match service voltage to your equipment specifications.

faqs.question: Can I have both single-phase and three-phase in my facility?
faqs.answer: Yes. Three-phase service includes single-phase availability. Your three-phase panel can supply both three-phase circuits for appropriate equipment and single-phase circuits for lighting, outlets, and other standard loads.

seoContent.heading: Three-Phase Power Installation in South Florida
seoContent.body: Large equipment and industrial operations require three-phase power that single-phase service can't provide. Solomon Electric installs three-phase electrical service throughout Miami-Dade and Broward counties—coordinating with FPL, installing appropriate infrastructure, and connecting equipment that demands three-phase power.

seoContent.heading: Utility Coordination for 3-Phase
seoContent.body: Three-phase installation requires utility coordination for transformer and service requirements. We work directly with FPL to determine availability, design appropriate service, and coordinate all utility work. Managing this coordination is a key part of our service.

seoContent.heading: Industrial and Commercial Applications
seoContent.body: Manufacturing facilities, machine shops, commercial kitchens, and data centers commonly require three-phase power. We install complete three-phase systems—service entrance, panels, feeders, and equipment connections—for industrial and commercial applications.

seoContent.heading: Serving South Florida Industrial Needs
seoContent.body: Solomon Electric provides three-phase power installation throughout Miami, Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Boca Raton, and all surrounding industrial areas. From equipment upgrades to complete facility power, we deliver the three-phase infrastructure your operations require.

imageAlt: Three-Phase Power Installation service provided by licensed electricians in South Florida
